item.title: Gory Tamil poems
item.description: Source: here. The old woman’s shoulders were dry, unfleshed, with outstanding veins; her low belly was like a lily pad. When people said her son had taken fright, had turned his back on battle and died, she raged and shouted, ” If he really broke down in the thick of strife, I’ll slash these breasts that gave him suck,” and went there sword in hand.
